name: Roy Maxion
content: Roy Maxion's Home Page Roy A. Maxion Courses Research Methods for Experimental Computer Science / Dependable & Survivable Systems Research Projects Keystroke forensics, Experiments in CyberSpace, Dependable systems, Information warfare, Intrusion-, Insider/Masquerader- and Fault-detection Research Interests Keystroke dynamics/forensics, fault/masquerader/insider/intrusion detection, attacker/defender testbed, measurement and experimental methodology, reliable software/user interfaces Dependable Systems Lab Research goals, projects, etc. Recent Publications Keystroke dynamics/forensics, anomaly/intrusion/masquerade detection, dependability cases, fault injection, user-interface dependability Data sets Keystroke dynamics/forensics Maxims (1) Pay attention to details. (2) Don't make "stuff" up. Roy A. Maxion, Ph.D. Research Professor Carnegie Mellon University Computer Science Department 5000 Forbes Avenue Pittsburgh, PA 15213-3891 +1-412-268-7556 Email: maxion AT cs DOT cmu DOT edu.
